subject: CLS

info: Current techniques used in lab diagnosis of infectious disease. Isolating/identifying bacteria/yeasts. Antimicrobial susceptibility testing. Lecture.

title: Seminar:  CLS
info: Current literature. Presentation/discussion of research.

title: Journal Presentations

title: Practicum Teaching
info: Supervised teaching experience, develop skills using instructional materials, tests, and measurements.

info: Basic concepts in management and education.

title: Lab Admin

info: Theory/application of basic principles in clinical Hematology. Lecture, lab.

subject: CLS
title: Hematology II
info: Fundamentals of examining blood and bone marrow. Identification of normal, immature, and abnormal cells.  Correlation of clinical and lab findings. Lecture, lab.

info: Principles/application of clinical chemistry. Correlation of clinical/lab findings.

subject: CLS
title: Clinical Chemistry II: Lab
info: Principles/application of lab procedures in clinical chemistry.

subject: CLS
title: Clin Chem I: Lab
info: Application of clinical chemistry principles and laboratory techniques in the analysis of urine, plasma, and body fluids.  Emphasis on laboratory tests to evaluate renal function, electrolytes, and acid-base balance.  Introduction to principles and processes for managing test quality.  Laboratory.

subject: CLS
title: Molecular Diagnostics
info: Basic theory/application of molecular diagnostics in clinical lab. Lecture, lab.

subject: CLS
title: Intro Transfusion Medicine
info: Principles of blood grouping, antibody identification, compatibility testing, and donor testing.

subject: CLS
title: Transfusion Med Laboratory
info: Exercises illustrating basic techniques in blood grouping, antibody identification, compatibility testing, and donor testing.

title: Education and Research
info: Basic concepts in education and research as applied to the clinical laboratory.

info: Practical experience collecting bone marrow from patients. Diagnosing hematological diseases by evaluating and interpreting cells from clinical specimens of bone marrow, peripheral blood, and, if applicable, lymph nodes.
